Author: TrashcanDarling
Text: I second this. We need to realize that we're not the average person, and things that can be triggering to us can be helpful to others. If MFP is triggering to you, then don't use it.

Author: motif2019
Text: It is your responsibility to avoid triggering content, not MFP's responsibility to avoid triggering you. That sounds like a totally normal article subject and title to me. While it would be nice if they offered users the chance to opt out of the article feed, as a private entity those clicks and your info are how they make a profit.  The nature of triggers is that they are irrational. MFP is not designed to be used by people with eating disorders â€” they have many safeguards in place for this reason. I think you should consider using another app or going analog.
